info.title: Socure API Reference
info.description:
The Socure ID+ identity verification solution is a real-time, predictive analytics platform that provides identity verification and fraud prediction through a single, modular REST API. # Authentication All API requests must include an ID+ key and Content-Type in the header. See [ID+ Endpoint](/docs/apis/endpoints/idplus-endpoint) for more information. ``` Authorization: SocureApiKey a1b234cd-5678-9e01-f234-56abcdef6789 Content-Type: application/json ``` ## Content-Type The Content-Type identifies the type of content submitted in the request body.
Endpoint Content-Type
ID+ application/json
Predictive Document Verification multipart/form-data
Reason Code application/json
# Rate Limits Socure limits the number of requests that can be sent to the API to 10 transactions per second for each ID+ key. To increase rate limits for your account, contact [Technical Support](/support). # Errors HTTP status codes indicate the success or failure of an API request. If a request fails, the API returns a message with information about the error along with the appropriate status code. See [Error Messages in ID+](/docs/apis/error-codes) for more information. > Error messages are intended for debug purposes only and should not be exposed to customers. ``` { "status": "Error", "referenceId": "81cf9bf1-b5ab-4271-bf92-8809ee1bf8d6", "data": { "parameters": [ "Missing required parameters for module: FraudScore" ] }, "msg": "Invalid request. Please check for missing required parameters and resubmit the transaction. " } ```

tags.name: ID+
tags.description:
ID+ is the primary endpoint of the Socure API. The ``modules`` parameter
in the request body determines which ID+ services are called. See [ID+
Modules](/docs/idplus/modules/products-overview) for more information.

tags.name: Predictive Document Verification
tags.description:
Predictive Document Verification enables you to confirm the authenticity of a wide
range of government-issued identification cards, including Driver's
Licenses, Passports, Visas, and other official documents.


The Predictive Document Verification service requires two API calls. The first call
uploads an image of an ID to the Document Upload endpoint. The API returns
a UUID for the transaction. The second call is made to the ID+ endpoint.
In this call, you include the ``documentverification`` module and UUID for
the transaction. The API returns a recommendation if the document is
authentic. See [Predictive Document
Verification](/docs/idplus/modules/docv/docv-overview) for more information.


You can also use the Image Request endpoint to retrieve a zip file
containing the images of the uploaded ID. See [Image Request
Endpoint](/docs/apis/endpoints/image-request-endpoint) for more
information.

tags.name: Reason Code
tags.description: Reason Codes are a series of alphanumeric codes returned by the ID+ endpoint that help explain what predictors were used to determine a score. See [Reason Codes in ID+](/docs/idplus/reason-codes) for more information.

tags.name: Transaction Details
tags.description:
The Transaction Details API allows you to use the reference ID 
of a previous transaction to view response data. See 
[Transaction Details Endpoint](/docs/apis/endpoints/transaction-details-endpoint) for more information.

 **Note**: The Transaction Details API is only available in the Certification and Production environments. API calls to the Sandbox enivronment will fail.

tags.name: Feedback
tags.description:
The Feedback API allows you to send labeled transaction data in real-time. This information 
should be sent for all ID+ transactions when the following occurs:

* The moment final application decisions are made.
* The moment account status changes on the Fraud Outcome or Delinquency buckets.

See [Feedback Overview](/docs/idplus/feedback/feedback-overview)
for more information.

tags.name: Events
tags.description:
The Events API allows you to manage webhook events for Global Watchlist and DocV Web SDK transactions. Use the 
API to do the following:

* Enable/disable monitoring for a Global Watchlist transaction.
* Suppress/unsupress Global Watchlist entity matches.
* Retrieve the monitoring status for a Global Watchlist transaction.
* Retrieve a list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions.
* Retrieve snapshot details for a Global Watchlist or DocV Web SDK transaction.
* Add a webhook secret key.

**Note**: Use the `/api/3.0/events` endpoint in the Sandbox environment to test the following operations:
- Enable/disable monitoring of a Global Watchlist transaction.
- Suppress/unsupress Global Watchlist entity matches.
- Retrieve the monitoring status for a Global Watchlist transaction.
- Retrieve a list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions.
- Retrieve snapshot details of a Global Watchlist.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Webhooks allow you to receive real-time notifications when an event occurs. Details about the event are sent via 
a HTTP `POST` request to the URL you specify. 

When you receive a new event, you must return a `200` HTTP status code. If you do not send a `200` response, Socure 
will attempt to redeliver the event. After five failed attempts over two days, the event delivery is marked as a 
failure and the webhook is disabled.

 **Note**: For auto-enrolled transactions, we will attempt to redeliver the notification until it is successfully received.

See [Webhooks Overview](/docs/webhooks/overview) for more information.

post.description: Creates a transaction using one or more ID+ modules.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.
> **Note**: You must specify the inquiry request type for Account Intelligence in the `inquiries` field. The inquiry type will determine which other fields are required.

firstName.description:
The consumer’s first name. 
> **Note**: 
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This field is required for `OWNERSHIP` inquiries of a consumer account.

surName.description:
The consumer’s last name. Required for `OWNERSHIP` inquries.
> **Note**:  
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This field is required for `OWNERSHIP` inquiries of a consumer account.

businessName.description:
The business entity name. 
> **Note**: 
> - The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=
> - This field is required for `OWNERSHIP` if `firstName` and `surName` are not provided.

physicalAddress.description: The first line of the consumer or business's address.

physicalAddress2.description: An optional second line for the address.

city.description: The city where the consumer or business resides.

state.description: The state, province, or region where the consumer or business resides, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.

country.description: The country where the consumer or business resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

nationalId.description: The consumer's nine digit Social Security number (SSN) or Individual Tax Identification Number. The last four digits of the SSN are also accepted. Hyphens are optional.

ein.description: Employer Identification Number (EIN) value used to idenitfy a business entity. Recommended when `businessName` is present.

mobileNumber.description: The consumer or business's phone number in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred.

payments.description: The bank account information associated with the transaction.

account.title: Account
account.description: The bank account information and inquiry types associated with the transaction.

accountNumber.description: The account number for which account validations are being performed.

routingNumber.description: The account routing number for which account validations are being performed.

inquiries.description:
The inquiry type. Below are the possible values. 
- `STATUS`: Used to confirm a bank account status. 
- `OWNERSHIP`: Used to verify a bank account ownership.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `city`, `state`
> 2. `zip`

firstName.description:
The consumer’s first name.
> **Note**: The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=

surName.description:
The consumer’s last name.
> **Note**: The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=

physicalAddress.description: The first line of the consumer's address.

city.description: The city where the consumer resides.

state.description: The state, province, or region where the consumer resides, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.

zip.description: The consumer's five or nine digit ZIP code in valid postal address format. Hyphens are optional.

country.description: The country where the consumer resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

phone.description:
The shipping recipient's phone number in E.164 format. 
A mobile phone number is preferred.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the `modules` array, you must also include at least 
one of the following parameters in the request.
> 1. `nationalId`
> 2. `email`
> 3. `mobileNumber`

mobileNumber.description: The consumer’s phone number in E.164 format. Hyphens are optional. A mobile phone number is preferred.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: ID+ returns a decision only when additional modules are included in the request.
The name of the ID+ module.

documentUuid.description:
Predictive Document Verification only. Enter the UUID received when submitting the
document images.

driverLicenseState.description: The two letter postal code of the issuing state.

modules.description: The name of the ID+ module.

nationalId.description: The consumer's nine digit Social Security number. Hyphens are optional.

ipAddress.description: The consumer's IP address in IPv4 decimal or IPv6 hexadecimal format.

consentTimestamp.description: The date and time when the consumer provided consent. If no value is provided, defaults to the current timestamp of the transaction.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: To receive the email correlation value in the response, 
include the following parameters in the request.
> - `firstName`
> - `surName`
> - `country`

The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.      
> 1. `nationalId`
> 2. `dob`
> 3. `physicalAddress`, `city`, `state`, `zip`

userConsent.description:
Indicates if the consumer has provided consent.
> **Note**: `userConsent` is required and must be set to true when implicitly calling eCBSV with the `kyc` module.

consentTimestamp.description:
The date and time when the user provided consent. If no value is provided, defaults to 
the current timestamp of the transaction.
> **Note**: `consentTimestamp` should only be sent when implicitly calling eCBSV with 
the `kyc` module.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.      
> 1. `city`, `state`
> 2. `zip`
> 3. `dob`

userConsent.description:
Indicates if the consumer has provided consent.
> **Note**: `userConsent` is required and must be set to true when implicitly calling eCBSV with the `kycplus` module.

consentTimestamp.description:
The date and time when the user provided consent. If no value is provided, defaults to 
the current timestamp of the transaction.
> **Note**: `consentTimestamp` should only be sent when implicitly calling eCBSV with 
the `kycplus` module.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: To receive the phone correlation value in the response, 
include the following parameters in the request.
> - `firstName`
> - `surName`

The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `dob`
> 2. `physicalAddress`, `city`, `state`
> 3. `physicalAddress`, `zip`

nationalId.description: The full nine or last four digits of the consumer's SSN. The last four digits is recommended. Hyphens are optional.

modules.description: The name of the ID+ module.

deviceSessionId.description: The session ID retrieved from the consumer's browser.

username.description: The username associated with a consumer's account.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `email`
> 2. `mobileNumber`
> 3. `physicalAddress`, `zip`
> 4. `physicalAddress`, `city`, `zip`
> 5. `physicalAddress`, `state`, `zip`

addresses.title: Addresses
addresses.description: The addresses associated with a transaction. Each address must be a unique type. Up to three addresses are allowed.

line1.description: The first line of the address.

line2.description: An optional second line for the address.

city.description: The city in which the address is located.

state.description: The state, province, or region in which the address is located, specified in ISO 3166-2 format.

postalCode.description: The five or nine digit ZIP code in valid postal address format. Hyphens are optional.

country.description: The country in which the address is located, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

companyName.description: The name of the consumer's employer.

payments.title: Payments
payments.description: Money transfer details for the transaction.

recipientCountry.description: The country where the recipient of the money transfer resides, specified in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

id.description: A unique identifier for the merchant.

category.description: A free-form text field for merchant category information.

orderChannel.description: The channel through which the order was submitted.

orderAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

submissionDate.description: The date on which the order was submitted.

prevOrderCount.description: The total number of orders previously submitted by the account.

prevUnpaidOrderCount.description: The number of orders for which the account still owes money.

lastOrderDate.description:
The date on which the most recent order was submitted.
> **Note:** If there are no previous orders, set the value to `null`.

accountCreationDate.description: The date on which the account was created.

customerUserId.description: The client-specified reference ID for the transaction.

userId.description: The consumer's username, if allowed such an identifier in your application or service.

geocode.description: The geolocation where the consumer currently resides, specified in ISO 6709 format.

previousReferenceId.description: The `referenceId` of a previous ID+ transaction. Allows you to link multiple transactions together.

modules.description:
The name of the ID+ module.

> **Note**: In addition to the required parameters, you must also include at least 
one of the following sets of conditional parameters in the request.
> 1. `email`
> 2. `mobileNumber`
> 3. `nationalId`
> 4. `dob`
> 5. `physicalAddress`, `zip`
> 6. `physicalAddress`, `city`, `state`

The name of the ID+ module. 
> **Note**: The `social` module has been deprecated and is no longer supported.
The name of the ID+ module.

fullName.description:
Allows you to search for non-person entities, such as businesses, aircraft, and ships.
> **Note**: The following special characters are not supported: ^±!@£$%&*_+¡€#¢§¶•ªº«<>?\\/:;|=

watchlistFilters.description: Global Watchlist modules only. Overrides the Global Watchlist filters set on the Admin Dashboard.

nameDob.description: Overrides the default match criteria settings requiring the consumer's name and date of birth to match.

nameFuzzinessTolerance.description:
Determines the match threshold for the consumer's name. Valid values are any number between 0 and 1 with decimal precision.
Zero (0) is an exact match, while one (1) allows for a broad match.

dobMatchLogic.description:
Overrides the default match criteria settings requiring the date of birth to be within a 1-year radius or exact on YYYY/MM/DD or YYYY
when the date of birth is provided at the following match levels: exact_yyyy_mm_dd, one_year_radius_yyyy_mm_dd, exact_yyyy, one_year_radius_yyyy.

categories.description:
The lists to search.

**sanctions**, **enforcement**, and **pep** are valid for watchlistplus and watchlistpremier.
**adverseMedia** is valid for watchlistpremier only.

limit.description: The maximum number of entities returned with each query. Specify any value between 1-100.

countries.description: The countries from which to pull PEP and adverse media results. Values should be entered in a two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format.

modules.description: The name of the ID+ module.
The name of the ID+ module.

anyOf.title: Account Intelligence
anyOf.description:
Validates a bank account's status and ownership. Conditional parameters are
physicalAddress, city, state, country, zip, nationalId, ein, mobileNumber, dob.

status.description:
Results of the bank account status confirmation. Below are the possible values.   
- `Valid`: The account is open. 
- `Invalid`: The account is closed.
- `Unknown`: The account status is unknown at this time.

ownership.description:
Results of the bank account ownership validation. Below are the possible values. 
- `Match`: The input owner information and account information match the information on file.
- `No Match`: The input owner information or account information does not match the information on file.
- `Unknown`: The ownership is unknown at this time.

anyOf.title: Address Risk
anyOf.description:
Returns address risk and correlation scores. Conditional parameters are
physicalAddress, city, state, zip.

addressRisk.description: Contains the address risk score and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Represents the level of risk associated with an address. A higher score indicates a greater likelihood of fraud.

nameAddressCorrelation.description: Contains the address correlation value and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Indicates the strength of the relationship between the address and the consumer's `firstName` and `surName`.

anyOf.title: Alert List
anyOf.description: Socure maintains an Alert List of known fraudulent users and specific identifying traits, as reported by Socure and its customers. Submitted data is checked against that list according to variable matching logic and processing. Any potential matching fields are then displayed in the JSON response, along with associated reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

reportedCount.description: The number of times a PII element, for example, an email address,  has been reported or seen as part of a fraudulent transaction.

value.description: The recommended decision for the transaction.

modelName.description: The name of the logic model used in the decision.

modelVersion.description: The version of the logic model used in the decision.

details.description:
The triggers that led to the recommended decision for the transaction.

> **Note**: If a module returns an `accept` decision, no other information is shown.

alertlist.description: Checks an identify against Socure's list of known fraudulent consumers.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

addressrisk.description: Provides a risk analysis of an address.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

scores.description: The score that triggered the decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

devicerisk.description: Provides a risk analysis of a device to identity relationship.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

documentverification.description: Confirms the authenticity of government-issued identification cards.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

fraud.description: Indicates the likelihood an identity is fraudulent.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

scores.description: The scores that triggered the decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

kyc.description: Indicates whether the information entered by a consumer matches a known identity.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

fieldValidations.description: The scores that triggered the decision for the module.

emailrisk.description: Provides a risk analysis of an email address.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

scores.description: The scores that triggered the decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

phonerisk.description: Provides a risk analysis of a phone number.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

scores.description: The scores that triggered the decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

prefill.description: Returns the first five digits of a consumer's social security number.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

synthetic.description: Indicates the likelihood an identity is synthetic.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

scores.description: The scores that triggered the decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

watchliststandard.description: Checks an identity against government and law enforcement watch lists.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

watchlistplus.description: Checks an identity against government and law enforcement watch lists.

decision.description: The recommended decision for the module.

triggers.description: The reason codes that triggered the decision for the module.

anyOf.title: Predictive Document Verification
anyOf.description: In the Predictive Document Verification call, pass the UUID to the ID+ API. The API will return a recommendation if the documents should be accepted as authentic. This section contains information about the Predictive Document Verification Module. See Document Upload Endpoint for information about the Document Upload call, which must be made before calling this module.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

name.description: The risk strategy for the verification.

value.description:
The result for the verification test, can be accept, resubmit, review or
reject.

anyOf.title: eCBSV
anyOf.description:
Verifies a user's social security number, name, and date of birth 
match Social Security Administration records.

eCBSV.description: Contains actionable reason codes based on the information received from the Social Security Administration.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

anyOf.title: Email Risk
anyOf.description: Returns email risk and correlation scores. Conditional parameters are email.

emailRisk.description: Contains the email risk score and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Represents the level of risk associated with an email address. A higher score indicates a greater likelihood of fraud.

nameEmailCorrelation.description: Contains the email correlation value and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Indicates the strength of the relationship between the email address and the consumer's `firstName` and `surName.`

kyc.description: Contains the field validations and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

firstName.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input first name correlates with the best-matched entity.

surName.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input surname correlates with the best-matched entity.

streetAddress.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input physical address correlates with the best-matched entity.

city.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input city correlates with the best-matched entity.

state.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input state correlates with the best-matched entity.

zip.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input ZIP code correlates with the best-matched entity.

mobileNumber.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input phone number correlates with the best-matched entity.

dob.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input date of birth correlates with the best-matched entity.

ssn.description: A true `0.99` or false `0.01` value that indicates if the input Social Security number or Individual Tax Identification Number correlates with the best-matched entity.

kycplus.description: Contains the field validations and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

bestMatchedEntity.description:
Contains the resolved PII of the best-matched entity, the normalized input address,
and up to three prior addresses associated with the best-matched entity, if available.

firstName.description: The first name of the best-matched entity.

middleName.description: The middle name of the best-matched entity.

surName.description: The surname of the best-matched entity.

suffix.description: The suffix of the best-matched entity.

ssn.description: The nine digit Social Security Number of the best-matched entity.

dob.description: The date of birth of the best-matched entity.

mobileNumber.description: The phone number for the best-matched entity.

normalizedAddress.description:
The input address fields formatted in the standard approved by the postal body of the input country. 
For US addresses, the address will be formatted according to USPS standards.

streetAddress.description: The street address of the normalized input address.

city.description: The city in which the normalized input address is located.

state.description: The state in which the normalized input address is located.

zip.description: The ZIP code in which the normalized input address is located.

associatedPhoneNumbers.description:
Contains up to three prior phone numbers for the best-matched entity, if available. 
Phone numbers are listed in reverse chronological order.

phoneNumber.description: A prior phone number associated with the best-matched entity.

associatedAddresses.description:
Contains up to three prior addresses for the best-matched entity, if available. 
Addresses are listed in reverse chronological order.

streetAddress.description: The street address associated with the best-matched entity's prior address.

city.description: The city associated with the best-matched entity's prior address.

state.description: The state associated with the best-matched entity's prior address.

zip.description: The ZIP code associated with the best-matched entity's prior address.

anyOf.title: Phone Risk
anyOf.description:
Returns phone risk and correlation scores. Conditional parameters are
mobileNumber.

phoneRisk.description: Contains the phone risk score and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Represents the level of risk associated with a phone number. A higher score indicates a greater likelihood of fraud.

namePhoneCorrelation.description: Contains the phone correlation value and reason codes.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description: Indicates the strength of the relationship between the phone number and the consumer's `firstName` and `surName`.

prefill.description:
Contains the first five digits of the consumer's Social Security Number.

> **Note**: There are certain eligibility requirements to purchase the Prefill address feature enhancements
> related to minimum total contract value and specific use cases. Contact your Technical Account Manager or
> Strategic Account Manager to see if you qualify.

ssnFirst5.description: The first five digits of the consumer's Social Security Number.

anyOf.title: Device Risk
anyOf.description: Contains reason codes and historical metrics for the device.

deviceRisk.description: Device Risk reason codes and risk score.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description:
A number between `0.001` and `0.999` that indicates the likelihood that a device will engage in fraudulent activity.
> **Note**: A score of `-1.0` indicates that ID+ is unable to return a Device Risk risk score. This can occur, for example, when the `deviceSessionId` sent in the request is invalid.

deviceIdentityCorrelation.description: Device-to-identity correlation reason codes and score.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

score.description:
A number between `0.001` and `0.999` that indicates the strength of the correlation between a device and a consumer's identity.
> **Note**: A value of `-1.0` indicates that ID+ is unable to return a correlation value. This can occur, for example, when the `deviceSessionId` sent in the request is invalid.

information.description: Information on the device manufacturer, operating system, and browser.

deviceManufacturer.description:
The device manufacturer.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

deviceModelNumber.description:
The device model number.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

operatingSystem.description:
The device operating system.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

operatingSystemVersion.description:
The device operating system version.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

browserType.description:
The device browser.
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

browserVersion.description:
The device browser version. 
> **Note**: The maximum length of this property is based on past observations by Socure. Longer values are possible.

geolocation.description: Information on the device location based on the IP address and GPS data.

ipGeolocation.description: Device location data based on the IP address.

coordinates.description: The latitude and longitute coordinates of the device.

city.description: The city in which the device is located.

state.description: The state in which the device is located.

zip.description: The zip code in which the device is located.

country.description: The country in which the device is located.

gpsGeolocation.description: Device location data based on GPS data.

coordinates.description: The latitude and longitute coordinates of the device.

observations.description: Information on when a device was first seen and last seen by Socure.

firstSeen.description: The date and time the device was first seen.

lastSeen.description: The date and time the device was last seen.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique first names seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the first name.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique surnames seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the surname.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique emails seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the email.

uniqueCount.description: The number of unique mobile numbers seen with the device.

uniqueSharePercent.description: The percentage of transactions seen for this device that match on the mobile number.

anyOf.title: Sigma Identity Fraud
anyOf.description: The ID+ Fraud Score (fraud) is a number between 0 and 1 that helps predict the probability that the individual will commit a particular type of fraud.

fraud.description: Contains the fraud risk score, reason codes, and fraud classification model details.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

scores.description: Contains the fraud risk score and fraud classification model details.

name.description: The name of the fraud classification model mapped to your account.

version.description: The version number of the fraud classification model mapped to your account.

score.description: Predicts the inherent fraud risk associated with the input PII. A higher score indicates a greater likelihood of fraud.

anyOf.title: Sigma Synthetic
anyOf.description: Contains reason codes and a score indicating the likelihood an identity is synthetic.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

anyOf.title: Social
anyOf.description: The Social module returns information about relevant external web sites discovered when evaluating the submitted data. There is no returned score for the Social module; however, it does return related reason codes that summarize the findings of the data analysis, as well as providing the source URLs for the data. These sources can be useful during manual review.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

anyOf.title: Global Watchlist Standard
anyOf.description: Checks for entity information on key watch lists. Socure offers standard, plus, and premier levels. Only one may be called at a time. See the Global Watchlist topic for response examples.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

anyOf.title: Global Watchlist Plus
anyOf.description: Checks for entity information on key watch lists. Socure offers standard, plus, and premier levels. Only one may be called at a time. See the Gloobal Watchlist topic for response examples.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

anyOf.title: Global Watchlist Premier
anyOf.description: Checks for entity information on key watch lists. Socure offers standard, plus, and premier levels. Only one may be called at a time. See the Global Watchlist topic for response examples.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes for this transaction.

schema.title: ID+ Error Response
schema.description: There are invalid parameters in the request. See the 'msg' object for a description of the parameter that caused the error. May or may not return additional objects parameters or permissions, based on where the error occurs.

referenceId.description: A unique identifier for this error.

data.description: Contains an object or array that describes the error.

oneOf.title: Missing modules or mutually exclusive modules

msg.description: A short description of the error.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of reason codes
get.description: Returns a complete list of reason codes in ID+.

referenceId.description: A unique identifier for this response.

reasonCodes.description: A list of reason codes available in ID+.

get.description: Returns all response data of a transaction.

parameters.name: referenceId
parameters.description: The reference ID of the transaction.

referenceId.description: A unique reference ID for this transaction.

data.description: A list of details for the transaction response.

post.description: Uploads an image of an ID for Predictive Document Verification.

documentFront.description:
An image of the front of the ID. For passports, the front is the page
containing the consumer's name and photograph.

documentBack.description: An image of the back of the ID. This parameter is optional, but recommended for drivers licenses.

selfPortrait.description: A self-portrait of the consumer for facial recognition. This parameter is optional and can be used as an additional data point for verification.

documentType.description:
The document type based on the size-profile of the ID according to ISO/IEC 7810.

* ``license`` is for US drivers licenses.
* ``identificationCard`` is for documents similar in size to a US driver's license, such as Permanent Resident Cards.
* ``passport`` is for all passports.

schema.title: Document Upload Response
schema.description: Upon successful upload, the Document Upload API will return a referenceId and a uuid. Pass the uuid along with the Predictive Document Verification module when making a call to ID+.

post.description: Sends a request to the user to complete the image capture process.

verificationLevel.description:
The verification process workflow for the transaction.

* 1 is for document upload only.
* 2 is for document upload and document verification.
* 3 is for document upload, document verification, and Phone Risk.

config.description: The configurations for the Web SDK transaction request.

sendMessage.description: Specifies whether to send a SMS message to the consumer.

language.description:
Specifies the language package for the Capture App.
- `en` is for English 
- `es` is for Spanish
- `fr` is for French
- `zh-cn` is for Simplified Chinese

flow.description: The flow to use with this transaction.

redirectURL.description: The URL to redirect the consumer to.

customerUserId.description: The customer reference ID for the transaction.

firstName.description: The consumer’s first name or given name.

surName.description: The consumer's surname or last name.

mobileNumber.description:
The consumer's mobile phone number. 
> **Note**: `mobileNumber` is required for `verificationLevel` `3`.

physicalAddress.description: The consumer’s physical address in valid postal address format.

physicalAddress2.description: An additional line for the consumer's physical address.

city.description:
The consumer's city of residence in valid postal address format.

> **Note**: `city` is required for international requests.

state.description: The consumer’s state of residence entered as a USPS two-letter abbreviation.

zip.description: The consumer's ZIP code in valid postal address format.

country.description:
The consumer’s country of residence entered as a two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.

> **Note**: `country` is required for international requests.

schema.title: Capture Request Response
schema.description: Contains additional information about the request.

referenceId.description: The reference ID for the initiation request.
The reference ID for the document request session.

eventId.description: The event ID for the first event of the process.

status.description: The name of the current event.

createdAt.description: The date the transaction was created.

customerUserId.description: The customer reference ID for the transaction.

verificationLevel.description: The verification process workflow for the transaction.

qrCode.description: The base64-encoded value of the QR code.

url.description: The URL that initiates the Capture App flow on a mobile device.

referenceId.description: A unique identifier for this error.

data.description: A list of parameters that triggered the error.

parameters.description: The name of the parameter that triggered the error.

msg.description: A short description of the error.

get.description: Retrieves a zip file containing the uploaded images of an ID.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: The unique identifier associated with the uploaded images. The ``uuid`` is returned in the response when you upload an ID using the Document Upload endpoint.

parameters.name: imagequality
parameters.description:
The quality of the retrieved images.

The API returns the original images by default. Specify ``optimized`` to retrieve copies of the images that are compressed to a smaller file size. Only images above 650 DPI are optimized.

> **Note**: We recommend retrieving the original images.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns the specified image only. If omitted, the API will return all images.

schema.description: A zip file containing the requested images.

transactionId.description: The unique identifier assigned to the original transaction.

initialDecision.description: The initial decision for the application as returned by the auto-decision system.

finalDecision.description: The final decision for the application as returned by the auto-decision system or manual review process.

fraudOutcome.description: Identifies whether a transaction was determined to be fraudulent based on the application's current status.

eventDate.description:
The date an event occurred for the account, such as delinquency, fraud, charge-off, or bankruptcy. 

> **Note**: Only pass `null` if the `fraudOutcome` equals `not fraud`.

fraudType.description:
The fraud type. 

 >**Note**: Only pass `null` if the `fraudOutcome` equals `not fraud`.

docVOutcomeReasons.description:
The reason why the document was listed as fraud or suspected fraud.

>**Note**: `docVOutcomeReasons` is required for DocV transactions.

fraudSubtype.description: Free-form text field for additional information.

channel.description: The channel in which the transaction was initiated.

accountCreationDate.description:
The account creation date for the transaction. Use `-1` for cancelled accounts and `T00:00:00Z` 
if the account creation time is unknown.

orderAmount.description: The requested credit limit, loan amount, or funding amount for the transaction.

lossAmount.description:
The total amount recorded as a gross loss as a result of fraud, not including recovered funds.

> **Note**: `lossAmount` is required for Synthetic.

delinquencyBucket.description:
The total number of days an account is past due. Use `"0"` for accounts that were delinquent but have since been paid off.

> **Note**: `delinquencyBucket` is required for Synthetic.

referenceId.description: A unique reference ID for the transaction.

schema.description: There are invalid parameters in the request. See the 'msg' object for a description of the parameter that caused the error. May or may not return additional objects parameters or permissions, based on where the error occurs.

referenceId.description: A unique identifier for this error.

data.description: Contains an object or array that describes the error.

parameters.description: List of missing parameters or required parameters

msg.description: A short description of the error.

schema.description: There are invalid parameters in the request. See the 'msg' object for a description of the parameter that caused the error. May or may not return additional objects parameters or permissions, based on where the error occurs.

referenceId.description: A unique identifier for this error.

msg.description: A short description of the error.

post.description:
Use the `POST` method to manage your Global Watchlist transactions.

- Enable Global Watchlist monitoring for a transaction.
- Disable Global Watchlist monitoring.
- Suppress an entity match from appearing in future notifications.
- Unsupress an entity match.

See [Global Watchlist Monitoring](/docs/idplus/modules/global-watchlist/monitoring/watchlist-monitoring-overview) for more information.

userConsent.description: Indicates if the consumer has provided consent. Must be set to `true`.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

operation.description: The action to take for this transaction.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

operation.description: The action to take for this transaction.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

operation.description: The action to take for this transaction.

entityIds.description: The `entityIds` to suppress from future notifications.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

operation.description: The action to take for this transaction.

schema.title: Global Watchlist Screening with Monitoring Events Response

id.description: A unique reference ID for the request.

get.description:
Use the `GET` method to retrieve the following information:

- The monitoring status for a Global Watchlist transaction.
- A list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions.
- Global Watchlist monitoring transaction details.

oneOf.title: Retrieve monitoring status for a Global Watchlist transaction

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

oneOf.title: Retrieve a list of actively monitored Global Watchlist transactions

monitoringStatus.description: Indicates whether Global Watchlist monitoring is currently enabled.

sortDir.description: The sort direction in which to display the monitored transactions.

oneOf.title: Retrieve Global Watchlist monitoring transaction details

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the Global Watchlist or DocV Web SDK transaction.

snapshot.description: Indicates whether to return snapshot details for the transaction.

id.description: A unique reference ID for the request.

subscriptionStatus.description: Indicates whether or not the Global Watchlist monitoring subscription is currently enabled.

monitoringEnabled.description: Indicates whether or not Global Watchlist monitoring is enabled for the transaction.

id.description: A unique reference ID for the request.

totalCount.description: The number of transactions for which Global Watchlist monitoring is enabled.

referenceIds.description: The `referenceIds` of the transactions for which Global Watchlist monitoring is enabled.

page.description: The current page number being displayed.

id.description: A unique reference ID for the request.

environmentName.description: The environment in which the ID+ transaction took place.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

subscriptionStatus.description: Indicates whether or not the Global Watchlist monitoring subscription is currently enabled.

monitoringStatus.description: Indicates whether or not Global Watchlist monitoring is enabled for the transaction.

get.description: Use the `GET` method to retrieve details of a DocV Web SDK transaction.

post.description:
A webhook secret key is a user-defined token that allows you to verify that events sent to your 
endpoint are legitimate. Secret keys are configured at the account-level and apply to all environments. 
Only one secret key can be active at a time per subscription type.

See [Webhook Best Practices](/docs/webhooks/best-practices) for more information.

A new event is observed for a monitored transaction, such as the addition or removal of a 
person or non-person entity from a sanctions list.

See [Global Watchlist Monitoring](/docs/idplus/modules/global-watchlist/monitoring/watchlist-monitoring-overview) for more information.

id.description: A unique reference ID for the request.

origId.description: The reference ID of the Web SDK transaction.

environmentName.description: The environment in which the Web SDK transaction took place.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

matches.description: A list of Global Watchlist entity matches.

PEP Data.description: A list of politically exposed persons (PEP) matches.

status.description: The data's current status such as `added date`, `removed date` or `updated date`.

entityId.description: The ID assigned to the entity.

activeStartDate.description: The date the entity was added to the Global Watchlist.

name.description: The entity's name as appeared in the Global Watchlist.

aka.description: Other known alias the entity has been using.

post.description:
A new transaction is automatically enrolled in Global Watchlist monitoring. 

See [Global Watchlist Monitoring](/docs/idplus/modules/global-watchlist/monitoring/watchlist-monitoring-overview) for more information.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the ID+ transaction.

message.description: The environment in which the ID+ transaction took place.
message.example: Watchlist monitoring enabled automatically on reference transaction

post.description:
One of the following events occurs for a DocV Web SDK transaction:

* Process Initiated
* Capture App Opened
* Document Front Uploaded
* Document Back Uploaded
* Document Selfie Uploaded
* Documents Upload Successful
* Verification Completed
* Resubmit Required
* Session Expired
* Session Complete 

See [Predictive Document Verification Callbacks](/docs/webhooks/docv-callbacks) for more information.

id.description: A unique reference ID for the event.

origId.description: The reference ID of the Web SDK transaction.

environmentName.description: The environment in which the Web SDK transaction took place.

address.description: The address extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

dob.description: The date of birth extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

documentNumber.description: The document number extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

expirationDate.description: The expiration date extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

firstName.description: The first name extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

surName.description: The last name extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

fullName.description: The full name extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

parsedAddress.description: Contains the individual address fields extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

city.description: The city extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

physicalAddress.description: The street address extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

postalCode.description: The postal code extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

state.description: The state extracted from the barcode or MRZ.

uuid.description: The unique identifier associated with the uploaded images.

oneOf.description:
Document verification only. Enter the UUID received when submitting the
document images.

referenceId.description: The reference ID of the Web SDK transaction.

customerUserId.description: The customer reference ID submitted with the Web SDK transaction.
